channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9414] start-hbase.cmd doesn't need the execute flag.
item.description:
When you do start- and tabulation, since there start-hbase.cmd has the execution flag, completion go only up to start-hbase.

We should remove the execution flag for this script.
item.summary: start-hbase.cmd doesn't need the execute flag.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
What am I doing wrong here @jean-marc? The *.cmd scripts do not seem to have execute bit set:





durruti:trunk stack$ cd ../0.96/

durruti:0.96 stack$ svn propdel svn:executable bin/*.cmd

Attempting to delete nonexistent property 'svn:executable' on 'bin/hbase-config.cmd'

Attempting to delete nonexistent property 'svn:executable' on 'bin/hbase.cmd'

Attempting to delete nonexistent property 'svn:executable' on 'bin/start-hbase.cmd'

Attempting to delete nonexistent property 'svn:executable' on 'bin/stop-hbase.cmd'



durruti:0.96 stack$ ls -la bin/*cmd

rw-rr-  1 stack  staff   2361 Sep  4 22:07 bin/hbase-config.cmd

rw-rr-  1 stack  staff  12489 Sep  4 22:07 bin/hbase.cmd

rw-rr-  1 stack  staff   2262 Sep  4 22:07 bin/start-hbase.cmd

rw-rr-  1 stack  staff   1752 Sep  4 22:07 bin/stop-hbase.cmd

{cmd}


I seem to remember them having it set because I remember having the issue you describe myself.



Should we just resolve this?

Strange. I looked 


jmspaggiari@t430s:~/foo$ wget http://people.apache.org/~stack/0.96.0RC0/hbase-0.96.0-hadoop1-bin.tar.gz

--2013-09-04 17:11:05--  http://people.apache.org/~stack/0.96.0RC0/hbase-0.96.0-hadoop1-bin.tar.gz

Resolving people.apache.org (people.apache.org)... 140.211.11.9

Connecting to people.apache.org (people.apache.org)|140.211.11.9|:80... connected.

HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK

Length: 4872529 (4.6M) [application/x-gzip]

Saving to: `hbase-0.96.0-src.tar.gz'



100%[========================================================================================================================================================================================>] 4,872,529    528K/s   in 11s     



2013-09-04 17:17:58 (425 KB/s) - `hbase-0.96.0-src.tar.gz' saved [4872529/4872529]



jmspaggiari@t430s:~/foo$ tar -xzf hbase-0.96.0-src.tar.gz

jmspaggiari@t430s:~/foo$ ll hbase-0.96.0/bin/ | grep .cmd

-rwxr-xr-x 1 jmspaggiari jmspaggiari 12489 Aug 30 17:30 hbase.cmd

-rwxr-xr-x 1 jmspaggiari jmspaggiari  2361 Aug 30 17:30 hbase-config.cmd

-rwxr-xr-x 1 jmspaggiari jmspaggiari  2262 Aug 30 17:30 start-hbase.cmd

-rwxr-xr-x 1 jmspaggiari jmspaggiari  1752 Aug 30 17:30 stop-hbase.cmd

And even if I skip the file system I still see the execution flag setted:


jmspaggiari@t430s:~/foo$ tar --list --verbose --file=hbase-0.96.0-src.tar.gz | grep ".cmd"

-rw-r--r-- stack/staff    4023 2013-08-30 17:30 hbase-0.96.0/conf/hbase-env.cmd

-rwxr-xr-x stack/staff    2361 2013-08-30 17:30 hbase-0.96.0/bin/hbase-config.cmd

-rwxr-xr-x stack/staff   12489 2013-08-30 17:30 hbase-0.96.0/bin/hbase.cmd

-rwxr-xr-x stack/staff    2262 2013-08-30 17:30 hbase-0.96.0/bin/start-hbase.cmd

-rwxr-xr-x stack/staff    1752 2013-08-30 17:30 hbase-0.96.0/bin/stop-hbase.cmd

Is it possible that it's set on the build side?

You figured it Jean-Marc Spaggiari

Let me commit this. Seems to do right thing:


CHANGES.txt	LICENSE.txt	NOTICE.txt	README.txt	bin		conf		hbase-webapps	lib

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
